author: Kate Morris and Sally Brown
method: Preheat the oven to 200C/400F/Gas 6. Grease a small ovenproof dish. Mix the melted butter and bread together in a bowl. Mix the cream cheese and flour together in a bowl until well combined. Slowly mix in the milk until smooth. Stir in the spring onion and peas. Put the fish into the bottom of the dish, top with the cheese mixture, then the tomatoes and bread. Bake in the oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the fish is cooked through.
ingredients: vegetable oil, for greasing,  25g/1oz butter, melted ,  1 slice stale bread, torn into chunks,  50g/2oz cream cheese with garlic and herbs,  1 tsp plain flour,  125ml/4fl oz milk,  1 spring onion, sliced,  2 tbsp peas (if frozen, defrost under cold running water and drain),  1 fillet white fish (such as cod), skinned and bones removed,  6 cherry tomatoes, quartered
